p:
Seed dormancy-release and germination is very sensitive to local environmental conditions so annual seed germination rates could not be estimated in the laboratory. Seed germination was therefore estimated indirectly from seed density in the current winter
N
SB [t] , the density of seeds present in the seed bank of the previous winter
N
SB [t−1] that were still alive in the current year (
S seed
[t−1,t] ), and density of seeds that were produced in the interceding year that were still viable and remained dormant in winter (

Germ [t−1, t])). Germination between two time steps was estimated as follows:
